Find the number of real solutions to $\sin 6 \pi x = x.$
inference:
**Solution:**

$$\sin 6 \pi x = x$$

$$6 \pi x = \sin^{-1} x + 2k\pi \quad \text{or} \quad 6 \pi x = \pi - \sin^{-1} x + 2k\pi$$

$$x = \frac{\sin^{-1} x}{6 \pi} + \frac{k\pi}{3} \quad \text{or} \quad x = \frac{\pi - \sin^{-1} x}{6 \pi} + \frac{k\pi}{3}$$
